org.jetel.connection.jdbc

Class DBConnectionImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.connection.jdbc.AbstractDBConnection
        • org.jetel.connection.jdbc.DBConnectionImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConnection, DBConnection, IGraphElement

    public class DBConnectionImpl
extends AbstractDBConnection
    CloverETL class for connecting to databases.
    It practically wraps around JDBC's Connection class and adds some useful methods.
    Note: Default value of this property is true.
    XML attributes:
    idconnection identification
    dbConfig
    optional    		filename of the config file from which to take connection parameters
    If used, then all other attributes are ignored.
    jndiJNDI name of JDBC data source. Use it to access data source specified by application server. If used, attributes dbDriver, dbURL, user, password and driverLibrary are ignored.
    databasedatabase identifier, which is used to lookup build-in drivers
    dbDrivername of the JDBC driver
    dbURLURL of the database (aka connection string)
    user
    optional    		username to use when connecting to DB
    password
    optional    		password to use when connecting to DB
    driverLibrary
    optional    		name(s) (full path) of Java library file(s) (.jar,.zip,...) where to search for class containing JDBC driver specified in dbDriver parameter.
    In case of more libraries, use system path separator to delimit them (e.g. ";").
    threadSafeConnection
    optional    		if set, each thread gets its own connection. Can be used to prevent problems when multiple components conversate with DB through the same connection object which is not thread safe.

    Example:

    <Connection type="JDBC" dbConfig="connection.cfg" id="Connection2" />
    Note: any XML attribute name can also be used in the dbConfig file. If the option is set there, then the value is applied to the connection object created.

    Example of dbConfig file:

    **********
 driverLibrary=file\:/C\:/jdbcDrivers/ojdbc14.jar
 user=test
 dbDriver=oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver
 name=OracleDB
 password=test
 threadSafeConnection=true
 dbURL=jdbc\:oracle\:thin\:@koule\:1521\:xe
 ********
    The XML DTD describing the internal structure is as follows: * <!ATTLIST Connection id ID #REQUIRED type NMTOKEN (JDBC) #REQUIRED database CDATA #IMPLIED dbDriver CDATA #IMPLIED dbURL CDATA #IMPLIED dbConfig CDATA #IMPLIED driverLibrary CDATA #IMPLIED user CDATA #IMPLIED password CDATA #IMPLIED threadSafeConnection NMTOKEN (true | false) #IMPLIED passwordEncrypted NMTOKEN (true | false) #IMPLIED transactionIsolation (READ_UNCOMMITTED | READ_COMMITTED | REPEATABLE_READ | SERIALIZABLE ) #IMPLIED>
    Since:
    21. b?ezen 2004

      • init

        public void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Initialization of the graph element. This initialization is done exactly once at the start of the existence of this graph element. All resources which are intended to remain allocated during the whole time of the graph existence (including time between each graph run), should be allocated in this method. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.free() method.
        Specified by:
        init in interface IGraphElement
        Overrides:
        init in class GraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • getConnection

        public SqlConnection getConnection(java.lang.String elementId,
                          JdbcSpecific.OperationType operationType)
                            throws JetelException
        Returns connection instance for the given elementId and operation type. If this db connection is threads safe, all connection are cached, and elementId and operation type servers as key to hash map. This is main method for using DBConnection class. Each graph element can claim its respective db connection.
        Parameters:
        elementId -
        operationType -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        JetelException

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection(java.lang.String elementId,
                   JdbcSpecific.OperationType operationType)
        Closes connection stored in cache under key specified by elementId and operationType. Connection is closed only if DBConnection is thread-safe. Closed connection is also removed from cache.

      • checkConfig

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.
        Specified by:
